questions.question: Identify the condenser in the given image.
questions.explanation: Correct Answer: C) II Explanation: II represents the condenser. It is located beneath the stage, focusing light onto the specimen for better resolution and contrast. It has an adjustment knob for focusing the light beam. I represents the Objective Lens III represents the stage IV represents the Small Knob Part of the Light Microscope Function Source of Illumination Visible Light Stage Slides are placed on it Condenser Regulates the passage of light Big Knob Coarse adjustment Small Knob Fine adjustment Eyepiece Lens 10x magnification Objective Lens Scanner: 4x Low Power: 10x High Power: 40x Oil Immersion: 100x
